title: Improvements to building "cargo" packages
body:
This change introduces several features to improve the installation of packages written in Rust.

Fixes #16045 

cc @adamjstewart @hartzell @ax3l 

# Automatic Vendoring of Cargo Dependencies
This change introduces the ability automatically vendor cargo dependencies by way of the new `cargo_manifest` directive.

If the cargo package has locked its dependencies via a "Cargo.lock" file, that is considered to sufficiently check the dependencies for purposes of spack's checksum validation. If there is no "Cargo.lock" file, the user will be prompted to disable checksums, and the `--no-checksum` flag is respected

I still need to implement the caching of the vendored dependencies to support mirroring. See TODO.

## TODO
- [x] Add support for caching of cargo dependencies
- [x] `.cargo/config` must include non-crates.io sources
  - `.cargo/config` file should be derived from the output of `cargo vendor`.
  - Particularly necessary for packages from non-crates.io sources, since they may include dependencies via version control
- [x] Fix bug with cargo package as being listed as "already staged"
  - This happens because the `CargoStage` expands the root stage during its own fetch
  - EDIT: Just output a message indicating why the package is being staged early.

## Limitations
Currently only supports vendoring from a single cargo manifest per-package. Perhaps this should be expanded, but I think it's pretty rare for a single package to vendor Cargo dependencies from multiple, disjoint manifests.

# `CargoPackage`
This PR also includes a new `CargoPackage` base class, which stream-lines building cargo packages. This automatically implements `build` and `install`.

This is NOT implemented using `cargo install` because it only installs bin targets. However, I suspect a common case will be to also install dynamic and static libraries with a C interface. Therefore, I manually implement the install for all "bin", "staticlib", and "cdylib" targets.

Additionally, I provide a new `crates_io` fetch strategy. This makes it possible to directly import packages from "crates.io", which is the first-party package repository for Rust. The goal is to streamline import of Rust packages that people want to use.

## TODO
- [x] Make it easy to specify cargo features via spack variants.

## Limitations
In the future, it may be necessary to provide a way to specify the targets which will be installed.

# Miscellania
Implemented `cargo checksum` for `crates_io` packages.

Fixed a bug in `_determine_extension` to respect `fetcher.extension`.

Add `ytop` package.

Update `bat`, `fd-find`, `ripgrep`, and `rust-bindgen` packages to use `CargoPackage`.
